title: Autism traits quick screen
description: A short self check for social communication and sensory patterns.

questions.text: Small sounds or details grab my attention more than they do for other people.
I focus on details more than the overall picture.
In groups, following multiple conversations feels hard.
Switching between tasks or topics feels hard.
I miss hints or implied meaning in conversation.
I find facial expressions hard to read.
I struggle to imagine how a situation seems from someone elseâ€™s point of view.
I notice patterns in things more than other people do.
New social situations feel stressful or confusing.
Making new friends feels hard.

scoring.positiveText: Score meets the screen threshold. A GP chat about an autism assessment is worth considering.
scoring.negativeText: Score is below the screen threshold. If symptoms affect daily life, a GP chat still makes sense.

title: Attention and impulsivity quick screen
description: A short self check for attention, organisation, and restlessness over the last 6 months.

questions.text: I start tasks, then struggle to finish the last details.
I struggle to organise tasks that need planning.
I forget appointments or obligations.
I put off tasks that need sustained focus.
When sat for a while, I fidget or feel restless.
I feel driven, like slowing down is hard.

scoring.positiveText: Score meets the screen threshold. A GP chat about ADHD assessment is worth considering.
scoring.negativeText: Score is below the screen threshold. If symptoms affect daily life, a GP chat still makes sense.

title: Mood elevation quick screen
description: A short self check for periods of elevated or irritable mood and changes in energy.

questions.text: I had a period where I felt unusually high, upbeat, or overly confident.
I had a period where I felt unusually irritable, with more arguments or snapping.
I needed much less sleep and still felt full of energy.
I talked more than usual, or felt pressure to keep talking.
My thoughts raced, or I jumped between ideas quickly.
I got distracted more easily than usual.
I had much more energy than usual.
I became more active, busy, or productive than usual.
I became more social than usual, with more calls, messages, or plans.
My interest in sex increased a lot compared to usual.
I took risks that later caused problems, such as spending, driving, or big decisions.
Other people said my behaviour seemed unusual or excessive.
I felt more goal driven, with strong urges to start new projects.
Several of the Yes answers happened in the same period of time.
How much did this affect work, social life, or home life.

scoring.positiveText: Screen meets the threshold. A GP chat about bipolar assessment is worth considering.
scoring.negativeText: Screen is below the threshold. If episodes affect daily life, a GP chat still makes sense.

questions.text: Little interest or pleasure in doing things.
Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless.
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much.
Feeling tired or having little energy.
Poor appetite or overeating.
Feeling bad about yourself, or that you are a failure, or have let yourself or your family down.
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television.
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or the opposite, being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual.
Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself in some way.

scoring.positiveText: Score meets a common review threshold. Book a GP chat about depression symptoms.
scoring.negativeText: Score is below a common review threshold. If symptoms affect daily life, a GP chat still makes sense.

questions.text: Feeling nervous, anxious or on edge.
Not being able to stop or control worrying.
Worrying too much about different things.
Trouble relaxing.
Being so restless that it is hard to sit still.
Becoming easily annoyed or irritable.
Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen.

scoring.positiveText: Score meets a common review threshold. Book a GP chat about anxiety symptoms.
scoring.negativeText: Score is below a common review threshold. If symptoms affect daily life, a GP chat still makes sense.

questions.text: About how often did you feel tired out for no good reason?
About how often did you feel nervous?
About how often did you feel so nervous that nothing could calm you down?
About how often did you feel hopeless?
About how often did you feel restless or fidgety?
About how often did you feel so restless you could not sit still?
About how often did you feel depressed?
About how often did you feel that everything was an effort?
About how often did you feel so sad that nothing could cheer you up?
About how often did you feel worthless?

scoring.positiveText: Score meets a common distress threshold. Book a GP chat about stress and mood.
scoring.negativeText: Score is below a common distress threshold. If symptoms affect daily life, a GP chat still makes sense.

questions.text: About how often did you feel nervous?
About how often did you feel hopeless?
About how often did you feel restless or fidgety?
About how often did you feel so depressed that nothing could cheer you up?
About how often did you feel that everything was an effort?
About how often did you feel worthless?

scoring.positiveText: Score meets a common distress threshold. Book a GP chat about stress and mood.
scoring.negativeText: Score is below a common distress threshold. If symptoms affect daily life, a GP chat still makes sense.

questions.text: How often do you have a drink containing alcohol?
How many units of alcohol do you drink on a typical day when you are drinking?
How often have you had 6 or more units if female, or 8 or more if male, on a single occasion in the last year?

scoring.positiveText: Score meets a common risk threshold. Book a GP chat about alcohol use.
scoring.negativeText: Score is below a common risk threshold. If alcohol causes problems, a GP chat still makes sense.

title: DASS-21
description: Depression, anxiety, and stress symptom screener with subscales.

questions.text: I found it hard to wind down.

options.label: Did not apply to me at all
Applied to me to some degree, or some of the time
Applied to me to a considerable degree, or a good part of the time
Applied to me very much, or most of the time

questions.text: I was aware of dryness of my mouth.

options.label: Did not apply to me at all
Applied to me to some degree, or some of the time
Applied to me to a considerable degree, or a good part of the time
Applied to me very much, or most of the time

questions.text: I could not seem to experience any positive feeling at all.

options.label: Did not apply to me at all
